translated: Therefore, the wise and the learned should not think that the excellent teachings spoken by the Sugata are mutually contradictory.

original: 'dir ni thabs dang shes rab kyang bsam par bya'o /
analyzed: 'dir ni thabs dang shes rab kyang bsam par bya'o /
translated: Here, one should consider method and wisdom.

original: de la shes rab dman pa rnams dang / bla ma dam pas ma zin pa rnams dang sdig pa'i grogs po dang bcas pa rnams dang bdud kyi dbang du gyur pa rnams ni theg pa chen po gsang sngags bla na med pa rnams su thabs dang shes rab kyi sgras rmongs par 'gyur te bud med dangüîΩskyes bu 'ba' zhig la 'dod do //
analyzed: de la shes rab dman pa rnams dang / bla ma dam pas ma zin pa rnams dang sdig pa'i grogs po dang bcas pa rnams dang bdud kyi dbang du gyur pa rnams ni theg pa chen po gsang sngags bla na med pa rnams su thabs dang shes rab kyi sgras rmongs par 'gyur te bud med dang skyes bu 'ba' zhig la 'dod do //
translated: Those of lesser intelligence, those not held by holy gurus, those with sinful friends, and those under the power of demons will be confused by the terms method and wisdom in the unsurpassed secret mantra of the Mahayana and will assert that it is only about men and women.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis thabs mi mkhas pa'i skyes bur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin pa nyid kyis thabs mi mkhas pa'i skyes bur rig par bya ste /
translated: That should be recognized as the teaching of a person who is unskilled in the true nature of reality.

original: yang dag pa'i bka' bde bar gshegs pa'i dgongs pas ni thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul dpag tu med pa cig yod na'ang 'dir ni re zhig gtso bo gsum du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bka' bde bar gshegs pa'i dgongs pas ni thabs dang shes rab kyi tshul dpag tu med pa cig yod na'ang 'dir ni re zhig gtso bo gsum du shes par bya ste /
translated: The true words of the sugatas have an immeasurable way of method and wisdom, but here they should be understood as being primarily three:

original: dpe dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dpe dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: example, cause, and result.

original: de la dpe ni chos nyid stong pa nyid la gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rjes mnyam par sbyar zhing reg pa'i gnas skabs nas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dpag tu med pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' dag tu bgrod par byed pa /
analyzed: de la dpe ni chos nyid stong pa nyid la gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rjes mnyam par sbyar zhing reg pa'i gnas skabs nas sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dpag tu med pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing mtha' dag tu bgrod par byed pa /
translated: The example is that from the time of the union of the vajra of nondual pristine consciousness with the emptiness of reality, the infinite qualities of buddhahood are brought to all buddhafields.

original: bde ba chen po'i ngo bo rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba de mtshon pa'i phyir gsang sngags kyi rgyud bla na med pa rnams su /üîΩbcu drug lo lon mig yangs ma //
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i ngo bo rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba de mtshon pa'i phyir gsang sngags kyi rgyud bla na med pa rnams su / bcu drug lo lon mig yangs ma //
translated: In order to illustrate that great bliss, which is free from all concepts, the unexcelled tantras of secret mantraüîΩsay, ‚ÄúThe sixteen-year-old with wide eyes,‚Äù

original: zhes pa la sogs pa sbyor ba rnams gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa sbyor ba rnams gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: rmongs pa dag ni de la yang dag par 'dzin pa yang yod na /
analyzed: rmongs pa dag ni de la yang dag par 'dzin pa yang yod na /
translated: If there are those who grasp that as real,

original: de ni dper na nad pa gang zhig gis bdud rtsi tshol ba'i gnas su bdud rtsi tshol du phyin pa la dug dang bsres pa'i sbrang @7a * //
analyzed: de ni dper na nad pa gang zhig gis bdud rtsi tshol ba'i gnas su bdud rtsi tshol du phyin pa la dug dang bsres pa'i sbrang @7a * //
translated: it is like a patient who, in search of nectar, goes to a place where nectar is found, but mixes it with poison and drinks it.

original: rtsi dang phrad pa las ro mngar ba'i bde ba bla na med pa nyams su myong ba las bdud rtsi ni nges par 'di'o snyam nas gnas su khyer te zos pa dang sdug bsngal chen pos 'chi ba'i dus byas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsi dang phrad pa las ro mngar ba'i bde ba bla na med pa nyams su myong ba las bdud rtsi ni nges par 'di'o snyam nas gnas su khyer te zos pa dang sdug bsngal chen pos 'chi ba'i dus byas pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as, for example, the gods and demons, having gathered together, created the world and its inhabitants, and then, later, the demons, out of jealousy, destroyed it.

original: de la rgyu ni 'dir rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rgyu ni 'dir rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause here is twofold:

original: rtsa ba'i rgyu dang las su bya ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyu dang las su bya ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: the fundamental cause and the cause as activity.

original: de la rtsa ba'i rgyu ni byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po ste /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i rgyu ni byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po ste /
translated: The fundamental cause is great love and great compassion.

original: byang chub kyi sems las yang dag par byung ba'i snying rje chen pos 'gro ba sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las bsgral ba'i phyir rims drag pos gdungs pa lta bu skye ba nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems las yang dag par byung ba'i snying rje chen pos 'gro ba sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las bsgral ba'i phyir rims drag pos gdungs pa lta bu skye ba nyid do //
translated: Great compassion, which arises from the thought of enlightenment, is born like a violent fever, in order to deliver all living beings from the ocean of transmigration.

original: de'i dbang gis byang chub kyi sems bla na med pa las yang dag par byung ba'i byams pa chen pos 'gro ba sems can thams cad la chos dang zang zing dang skyabs dang bde ba'i tshig la sogs pas phan gdags pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'o //üîΩde lta bu yang dag par chu bo'i rgyun lta bus mnyam par sbyar ba las bde ba rnam pa gnyis 'byung ba ste bdag nyid sems kyi dga' bas dmigs pa med pa'i bde ba chen po dang gzhan du 'phral gyi bde ba mngon par dga' ba'i bde ba
analyzed: de'i dbang gis byang chub kyi sems bla na med pa las yang dag par byung ba'i byams pa chen pos 'gro ba sems can thams cad la chos dang zang zing dang skyabs dang bde ba'i tshig la sogs pas phan gdags pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'o // de lta bu yang dag par chu bo'i rgyun lta bus mnyam par sbyar ba las bde ba rnam pa gnyis 'byung ba ste bdag nyid sems kyi dga' bas dmigs pa med pa'i bde ba chen po dang gzhan du 'phral gyi bde ba mngon par dga' ba'i bde ba
translated: The cause of its accomplishment is the benefit of all sentient beings by means of great love, which arises from the unsurpassed thought of enlightenment, through the words of Dharma, material things, protection, and happiness.

original: chen po skye ba nyid do //
analyzed: chen po skye ba nyid do //
translated: From the union with such a river of reality, the two kinds of happiness arise: the happiness of the great joy of the mind, which is the objectless great bliss, and the happiness of the great delight in the immediate bliss of others.

original: las su bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: las su bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The action is twofold:

original: nang gi bdag nyid can dang kun tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid can dang kun tu spyod pa'o //
translated: the internal and the external.

original: de la nang gi bdag nyid can bla ma dam pas chos kyi 'khor lo chen pos yang dag pa'i don ma nor bar bstan pa nyid nges pa nyid du byas pas bsgoms shing de la bde ba chen po rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i skad
analyzed: de la nang gi bdag nyid can bla ma dam pas chos kyi 'khor lo chen pos yang dag pa'i don ma nor bar bstan pa nyid nges pa nyid du byas pas bsgoms shing de la bde ba chen po rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i skad
translated: The inner nature is the guru, who turns the great wheel of dharma and teaches the unerring meaning of the truth.

original: cig gam thang cig gam nyi ma'am zhag gam zla ba'am lo la sogs par skye ba ni rgyu bla na med pa nyid do //
analyzed: cig gam thang cig gam nyi ma'am zhag gam zla ba'am lo la sogs par skye ba ni rgyu bla na med pa nyid do //
translated: The cause is the arising of great bliss, free from all concepts, in a single moment, instant, day, night, month, or year.

analyzed: kun tu spyod pa ni 'dir rgyal ba'i bka' thams cad las legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba'am /

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa'am byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa'am byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa la sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'am /

original: bram ze'am rgyal rigs sam rje'u rigs la sogs pas rang rang gi kun tu spyod pas ni 'jig rten pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du yang dag par spyod pa dang / gsang sngags rdo rje'i theg pa'i don la yang dag par bsgoms pas ni rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes rab skye ste /
analyzed: bram ze'am rgyal rigs sam rje'u rigs la sogs pas rang rang gi kun tu spyod pas ni 'jig rten pa dang rjes su mthun pa nyid du yang dag par spyod pa dang / gsang sngags rdo rje'i theg pa'i don la yang dag par bsgoms pas ni rtog pa dang bral ba'i shes rab skye ste /
translated: By the conduct of each of the castes, such as the brahmin, the warrior, the merchant, one practices in accordance with the world. By correct meditation on the meaning of the Vajra Vehicle of Secret Mantra, the wisdom free from discursive thought arises.

original: de las bde ba chen po rnam pa gnyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las bde ba chen po rnam pa gnyis 'byung ngo //
translated: From that, the two kinds of great bliss arise.

original: de la rang gi rgyud la ni ngo tsha ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / mi zhim pa dang / @7b 'jigs pa la sogs pas sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la mos pa dang / dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i bde ba bskyed pa nyid ni thabs bla na med pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la rang gi rgyud la ni ngo tsha ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / mi zhim pa dang / @7b 'jigs pa la sogs pas sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la mos pa dang / dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i bde ba bskyed pa nyid ni thabs bla na med pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therein, the bliss that does not cause suffering in one's continuum by shame, impurity, foul smell, fear, and so on, and the bliss that generates devotion, joy, and attraction in another's continuum is called the unsurpassed method.

original: de la 'bras bu ni stong pa nyid la gnyis su med pa'i rdo rjes sangs rgyas pa'i chos thams cad mngon du byas pa'i bde ba chen po thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu ni stong pa nyid la gnyis su med pa'i rdo rjes sangs rgyas pa'i chos thams cad mngon du byas pa'i bde ba chen po thob pa nyid do //
translated: The result is the attainment of great bliss, which is the actualization of all the qualities of buddhahood by means of the vajra of nonduality with emptiness.

analyzed: yang gsang sngags kyi rgyud bla na med pa rnams su yab dang yum gyi tshul du chags pa chen pos rol pa'i chos bstan pa'am /

original: sku gzungs la sogs pa mnyam par sbyar ba'i sku mthong ba la gang dag mi shes pa rnams de 'dra ba nyid kyi gzugs su bde bar gshegs pa rnams bzhugs par 'dod na /

analyzed: de lta na ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ba rgyal ba thams cad bskyed pa'i yum lta bu'i chos kyi mtshan nyid tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi'i gzugs su phyag bzhi pa'i bud med kyi tshul du bris pa yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: then the perfection of wisdom, which is like the mother of all the conquerors, should also be drawn in the form of a four-armed woman, the form of the four immeasurables, the characteristics of phenomena.

analyzed: pa de bud med de lta bu'i gzugs su yod dam /

analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' ldan gyi gnas su byams pa rgyal tshab tu bzhag nas mi'i yul du gser gyi glang po che mche ba drug par sbrul te / zas gtsang ma'i btsun mo'i mngal du mir skye ba bzhes te mdzad pa bcu gnyis rim pa bzhin du mdzad nas rdo rje'i gdan la mngon par bzhugs pa'i gnas skabs na lha'i bu'i bdud dga' rab dbang phyug la sogs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes
translated: Moreover, after the Bhagavat, having placed Maitreya as regent in the Tu·π£ita realm, emanated as a golden elephant with six tusks in the human realm,üîΩand having taken birth as a human in the womb of ≈öuddhodana‚Äôs wife, having gradually performed the twelve deeds, at the time of his manifest enlightenment on the vajra seat, the sons of the gods such as ƒ™≈õvara, the mƒÅra of the afflictions, and so on said, ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable for the Bhagavat to sit on the vajra seat without obtaining omniscient gnosis.‚Äù

analyzed: ma thob par rdo rje gdan la 'dug pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bdud rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat said to the mƒÅras:

translated: ‚ÄúI am not here at this time.üîΩAs long as there are elements such as earth and water,

analyzed: 'byung ba yod pa de srid nas //
translated: for that long

analyzed: sdig can khyed kyis shes pa min //
translated: You, sinner, do not know this!

original: zhes gsungs pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: At that time,

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis sa'i lha mo dang chu'i lha mo mdog ser ba dang / sngo ba bum pa dang padma 'dzin pa gnyis bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas g-yon nas rked pa yan chad phyung ste tshig 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: by the power of the Sugata, the earth goddess and the water goddess, both yellow in color, holding vases and lotuses, emerged up to their waists from the right and left of the Bhagavan and said these words:

analyzed: kye ma khyed kyis ci la shes //
translated: ‚ÄúOh! What do you know?

original: bdag cag 'byung ba rnam pas kyang//
analyzed: bdag cag 'byung ba rnam pas kyang//
translated: We, the four elements,

analyzed: @8a * // khyod ni snga bar mngon sangs rgyas //
translated: you were first manifestly enlightened.

original: zhes pa'i tshig gis bdud rnams skyengs par gyur par byas pa sa la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhis rtsi shing dang nags tshal dang dngos po thams cad skyed pa'i tshul nas bud med kyi gzugs su phyung na de yang bud med de 'dra ba rang gi gzugs su
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gis bdud rnams skyengs par gyur par byas pa sa la sogs pa 'byung ba bzhis rtsi shing dang nags tshal dang dngos po thams cad skyed pa'i tshul nas bud med kyi gzugs su phyung na de yang bud med de 'dra ba rang gi gzugs su
translated: By these words, the demons were put to shame. The four elements such as earth, which give rise to all things such as plants, forests, and so forth, if they emerge in the form of women, that woman is like that.

original: gnas sam / de lta na ni sa la yang kha dog sna tshogs par snang ba'i phyir rigs par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnas sam / de lta na ni sa la yang kha dog sna tshogs par snang ba'i phyir rigs par mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: If it were so, then it would not be reasonable, because the earth appears to have various colors.

analyzed: de bas na bde bar gshegs pas chos kyi tshul gyi rtags sku ru bris pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the Sugata painted the sign of the Dharma method in his body.

original: yang na gong du bstan pa ltar chags pa chen pos 'dul ba'i sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir chags pa chen pos chos gsungs te 'gal ba med pa nyid do //üîΩgzhan du de 'dra ba nyid du 'dod na ni bde bar gshegs pa yang dag pa nyid dam grol ba nyid dam /
analyzed: yang na gong du bstan pa ltar chags pa chen pos 'dul ba'i sems can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir chags pa chen pos chos gsungs te 'gal ba med pa nyid do // gzhan du de 'dra ba nyid du 'dod na ni bde bar gshegs pa yang dag pa nyid dam grol ba nyid dam /
translated: Or, as taught above, he taught the Dharma with great passion in order to tame those sentient beings who are to be tamed by great passion. There is no contradiction.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were otherwise, and he were to be desired in that way, then the Sugata would not be true, liberated, or transcendent.

analyzed: nyid kyis gsungs pa'i chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bas na 'dir bde bar gshegs pa yang cig / des gsungs pa'i chos kyang gcig par blta ste /

original: phan tshun du 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phan tshun du 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
translated: They are seen to be mutually non-contradictory.

original: yang gzhan du mtshan sna tshogs su bstan pa khrag 'thung chen po dang / dgyes pa'i rdo rje dang 'jam pa'i rdo rje dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / rdo rje sems dpa' dang / sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang gzhan du mtshan sna tshogs su bstan pa khrag 'thung chen po dang / dgyes pa'i rdo rje dang 'jam pa'i rdo rje dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / rdo rje sems dpa' dang / sh'akya thub pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gcig pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, the one body of the Tathagata is taught in other tantras under various names, such as Great Blood Drinker, Hevajra, Manjushrivajra, Vairochana, Vajrasattva, Shakyamuni, and so forth.

original: gdul bya'i dbang gis sna tshogs par btags pa ni 'gal ba med pa nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: gdul bya'i dbang gis sna tshogs par btags pa ni 'gal ba med pa nyid kho na ste /

analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rdo rje gcod pa las ;
translated: Moreover, the Lord has said in the Diamond Cutter Perfection of Wisdom:

original: gang dag nga la gzugs su mthong //
analyzed: gang dag nga la gzugs su mthong //
translated: Those who see me as form,

analyzed: gang dag nga la sgrar shes pa // des ni log par rtogs pa ste //
translated: And those who know me as sound,üîΩThey practice a path that is not mine,

original: yang dag don du mthong thos med //
analyzed: yang dag don du mthong thos med //
translated: For the truth is not seen or heard.

original: ces pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i mdo las kyang //
analyzed: ces pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i mdo las kyang //
translated: And in the Abhisamayalankara:

original: bsgribs pa'i tshul gyis kun ston yang //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i tshul gyis kun ston yang //
translated: Although the obscurations are taught,

original: rtog pa spangs pas 'od gsal gang //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtog pa spangs pas 'od gsal gang //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The clear light is free from conceptualization.

original: de bas na bde bar gshegs pas kun rdzob kyi tshul du sems can mos pa sna tshogs pa rnams la gzugs dang chos dang spyod pa sna tshogs su bstan pa ni tha na srin bu la sogs pa yan chad kyi gzugs kyis ston kyang /üîΩdon dam par ni @8b gzugs dang kha dog tu snang ba lta zhog gi / sems can gyi mtshan mar snang ba kun rdzob kyi snang ba tsam yang med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na bde bar gshegs pas kun rdzob kyi tshul du sems can mos pa sna tshogs pa rnams la gzugs dang chos dang spyod pa sna tshogs su bstan pa ni tha na srin bu la sogs pa yan chad kyi gzugs kyis ston kyang / don dam par ni @8b gzugs dang kha dog tu snang ba lta zhog gi / sems can gyi mtshan mar snang ba kun rdzob kyi snang ba tsam yang med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the Sugata, in the manner of the relative, teaches various forms, dharmas, and conduct to sentient beings with various interests, even teaching with forms such as insects and so on.

original: rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: However, in the ultimate, one should view the nature of the mind as the nature of luminosity free from all concepts, without even the mere appearance of the relative, let alone the appearance of forms and colors.

original: de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa la zhugs pa rnams kyis ni lus kyi spyod pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa rang rang gi kun du spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ngag gi spyod pa rnams ni rin po che'i mdo la sogs pa la bslab par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa la zhugs pa rnams kyis ni lus kyi spyod pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa la sogs pa rang rang gi kun du spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ngag gi spyod pa rnams ni rin po che'i mdo la sogs pa la bslab par bya ba dang /
translated: Therefore, those who enter the teachings of the Sugata should train in the individual conduct of the vows of individual liberation and so on, the conduct of speech should be trained in the Ratnasa·πÉbhava, and so on.

original: yid kyi spyod pa rnams ni gsang sngags kyi don rnam par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi spyod pa rnams ni gsang sngags kyi don rnam par bsgom par bya ste /

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavat said in the Ratnakuta-sutra:üîΩThe conduct is pleasing and beautiful,

original: spyod pa yid 'ong mdzes pa dang // ngag rnams bram ze'i rig byed 'dra //
analyzed: spyod pa yid 'ong mdzes pa dang // ngag rnams bram ze'i rig byed 'dra //
translated: the speech is like the Vedas of the Brahmins,

original: yid ni zla phyed byis pa 'dra //
analyzed: yid ni zla phyed byis pa 'dra //
translated: the mind is like a young child.

original: de 'dra'i kun du spyod pas na //üîΩ'dir bde pha rol bla na med //
analyzed: de 'dra'i kun du spyod pas na // 'dir bde pha rol bla na med //
translated: With such conduct,

original: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there is happiness here and unsurpassed happiness in the next world.

original: de la yang gang dag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba dang / mdo sde dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bya ba'i rgyud rnams su ni kha zas kyi rnam pa sha dang chang dang sgog pa la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i tha ma la pa rnams kyang bkag la //
analyzed: de la yang gang dag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba dang / mdo sde dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bya ba'i rgyud rnams su ni kha zas kyi rnam pa sha dang chang dang sgog pa la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i tha ma la pa rnams kyang bkag la //
translated: In the well-spoken Dharma-Vinaya, the sutras, the perfections, and the kriya tantras, the types of food such as meat, alcohol, garlic, and so on, which are unsuitable and inferior, are prohibited.

original: gsang sngags bla na med pa rnams su ni /
analyzed: gsang sngags bla na med pa rnams su ni /
translated: But in the unsurpassed secret mantra,

original: sha las kyang sems can chen po rnams kyi sha mi sha dad glang po che'i sha la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten na shin tu mi gtsang ba'i dngos po bshang ba la sogs pa zas kyi mchog tu byed pa dang / de dag gi snod la yang mi'i thod pa la sogs par za ba ni 'gal ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: sha las kyang sems can chen po rnams kyi sha mi sha dad glang po che'i sha la sogs pa dang / 'jig rten na shin tu mi gtsang ba'i dngos po bshang ba la sogs pa zas kyi mchog tu byed pa dang / de dag gi snod la yang mi'i thod pa la sogs par za ba ni 'gal ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: Also, they eat from vessels such as human skulls.üîΩThis is not contradictory.

original: de ni 'gal ba med pa nyid de de la kha cig ni log par 'khrul ba'i dbang gis mi la sogs pa'i ro rku ba dang / gson pa rnams gsod pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: de ni 'gal ba med pa nyid de de la kha cig ni log par 'khrul ba'i dbang gis mi la sogs pa'i ro rku ba dang / gson pa rnams gsod pa'ang yod de /
translated: Some steal the corpses of humans and so on and kill the living through the power of wrong views.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhung dang 'gal bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad du gzhung dang 'gal bar rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as contradictory in every way to the scriptures.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' thams cad nas sems can gyi srog gcod pa ni mtshams med pa lnga dang nye bar bshad pas na /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i bka' thams cad nas sems can gyi srog gcod pa ni mtshams med pa lnga dang nye bar bshad pas na /
translated: Because all the scriptures of the sugatas explain that killing a sentient being is one of the five heinous actions.

original: de lta bu'i gang zag chen po ni theg pa chen po la khas 'ches pa lta zhog gi / ya rabs kyi spyod par yang mi rung bas na rigs kyi tha ma shan pa'i rigs su bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gang zag chen po ni theg pa chen po la khas 'ches pa lta zhog gi / ya rabs kyi spyod par yang mi rung bas na rigs kyi tha ma shan pa'i rigs su bsdu bar bya ste /

analyzed: de 'dra ba'i gang zag dang bde bar gshegs pa'i bstan pa la zhugs pa rnams kyis skad cig ma gcig kyang @9a * //

analyzed: lhan cig gnas par mi bya ba dang / gtam gyi 'brel ba tsam yang bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //

original: de la bde bar gshegs pas gang gsang sngags bla na med pa rnams su mi sha la sogs pa bza' bar bya ba'i dgos pa ni ci nas kyang sems can gyi srog la gnod pa spangs pa'i phyir te /

translated: In this regard, the purpose of the Sugata's teaching that one should eat human flesh and so forth in the unsurpassed secret mantra is so that one will abandon harming the lives of sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: bdag sha phal pa rnams zab na ma dang sring mo dang mdza' bo la sogs pas yid du 'ong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag sha phal pa rnams zab na ma dang sring mo dang mdza' bo la sogs pas yid du 'ong ba'i phyir /
translated: If one eats ordinary flesh, one will be mentally attracted to one's mother, sister, friends, and so forth.

original: sems can rnams bsad de /
analyzed: sems can rnams bsad de /
translated: Therefore, one should not kill sentient beings.

original: kha zas bsod pa dag stob par byed pa'i phyir dang / bdag kyang ro la chags pa'i dbang gis gnod sems dang gzhogs kyis bskul ba dang rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa'i sems skye ba dgag pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa gzhom pa'i rim pas 'jig rten na mi rnams kyis longs mi spyod cing smad par gyur pa dus thams cad du mod pa rin la sogs pa mi dgos shing sems can gyi srog la mi gnod pa'i sha dag bza' ba nyid do //
analyzed: kha zas bsod pa dag stob par byed pa'i phyir dang / bdag kyang ro la chags pa'i dbang gis gnod sems dang gzhogs kyis bskul ba dang rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa'i sems skye ba dgag pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa gzhom pa'i rim pas 'jig rten na mi rnams kyis longs mi spyod cing smad par gyur pa dus thams cad du mod pa rin la sogs pa mi dgos shing sems can gyi srog la mi gnod pa'i sha dag bza' ba nyid do //
translated: Because they offer him delicious food, and because he prevents the arising of thoughts of malice, slander, and rejoicing in his own disciples, who are attached to tastes, and because he destroys conceptualization, he always eats meat that is not prohibited, not censured in the world, not involving killing for his sake.üîΩ

original: yang ci nas kyang 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa chung bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang ci nas kyang 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rnams la chags pa chung bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they serve delicious food, and because they prevent the arising of thoughts of malice, slander, and rejoicing, due to attachment to taste, and because they destroy conceptualization, they should always eat meat that is not forbidden, not bought, and not requested, which is not harmful to sentient beings, and which is free from thought.

original: ngan cing smad pa ni chags pa'i yul du ma song ba la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa skye par mi 'gyur ba ste de ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba rnams su'ang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams 'bras chan la rus pa'i 'du shes su bskyed par
analyzed: ngan cing smad pa ni chags pa'i yul du ma song ba la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa skye par mi 'gyur ba ste de ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba rnams su'ang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams 'bras chan la rus pa'i 'du shes su bskyed par
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said in the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya that monks should generate the perception of bones with regard to rice,

original: bya ba dang / tshod ma la rang khrag gi 'du shes su bskyed par bya ba dang / shing lo la phags pa'i 'du shes su bskyed par bya ba dang lhung bzed la mi'i thod pa'i 'du shes bskyed de /
analyzed: bya ba dang / tshod ma la rang khrag gi 'du shes su bskyed par bya ba dang / shing lo la phags pa'i 'du shes su bskyed par bya ba dang lhung bzed la mi'i thod pa'i 'du shes bskyed de /
translated: generate the perception of their own blood with regard to vegetables, generate the perception of a rag with regard to leaves, and generate the perception of a human skull with regard to their alms bowl.

original: bde bar gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / bru ba'i nad las bzlog pa'i phyir bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / bru ba'i nad las bzlog pa'i phyir bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They should eat in order to serve the Sugata and to cure the illness of hunger.

original: yang ci nas kyang rnam par rtog pa gzhom pa'i phyir ta /
analyzed: yang ci nas kyang rnam par rtog pa gzhom pa'i phyir ta /
translated: Moreover, one should eat in order to destroy discursive thought.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two types of discursive thought.

original: gcig ni mngon par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs na dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa dang mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i ngo bos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs te /
analyzed: gcig ni mngon par rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs na dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa dang mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i ngo bos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rtogs te /
translated: One is that at the time of the stage of realization, one realizes all things as equality by the nature of having abandoned substantial conceptualization and conceptualization of signs.

original: bzang ba dang ngan pa dang zhim pa dang sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa @9b 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad dang bral ba'i rtags su yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bzang ba dang ngan pa dang zhim pa dang sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang snyan pa dang / mi snyan pa dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa @9b 'jig rten pa'i chos brgyad dang bral ba'i rtags su yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: It is perfectly taught as the sign of being free from the eight worldly dharmas, such as good and bad, delicious and disgusting, pleasant and unpleasant, happiness and suffering.

original: gcig ni nang du sems pa'i ngo bos dang por thig le dang / de nas aa ru ra'i 'bras bu tsam dang / de dag la sogs pa'i rim pas bza' ba nyid du byas na yun ring por goms pa'i mthus khad kyis rnam rtog chung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir slob pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: gcig ni nang du sems pa'i ngo bos dang por thig le dang / de nas aa ru ra'i 'bras bu tsam dang / de dag la sogs pa'i rim pas bza' ba nyid du byas na yun ring por goms pa'i mthus khad kyis rnam rtog chung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir slob pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: One is that at the time of training, by the nature of inwardly contemplating, first the bindu, then the size of an arura fruit, and so on, in stages, by the power of long-term familiarity, conceptualization gradually decreases.

original: de'i phyir mi la sogs pa'i sha bsten pa la 'gal ba med cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi la sogs pa'i sha bsten pa la 'gal ba med cing /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in consuming the flesh of humans and so forth.

original: mthun pa nyid dang / lang kar gshegs pa la sogs par sha thams cad bkag pa ni srin po la sogs pa'i sems can gyi srog 'phrog pa rnams gdul ba'i phyir /

translated: The Lankavatara and other sutras that prohibit all meat are for the purpose of subduing beings such as rakshasas who take the lives of others.üîΩThe Buddha said that eating meat has various disadvantages:

analyzed: sha za shes rab snying rje med //

analyzed: rnam par grol la rgyab kyis phyogs // zhes pa la sogs pa sha za ba'i nyes dmigs sna tshogs pa gcig gsungs so //

original: mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa rnams gsungs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i mad bstan pa la sogs par yang ci nas kyang sems can gyi srog la gnod kyis dgos pa dang / byang chub kyi sems shas chung gis dogs pa'i phyir bkag pa yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa rnams gsungs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i mad bstan pa la sogs par yang ci nas kyang sems can gyi srog la gnod kyis dgos pa dang / byang chub kyi sems shas chung gis dogs pa'i phyir bkag pa yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: You should understand that the sutras that teach the transcendence of suffering and the Bodhisattva vow prohibit meat because they are concerned that sentient beings will harm the lives of others and that the bodhichitta will diminish.

original: rnam pa thams cad du ma gnang ba ma yin te 'dul ba la sogs par dge slong rnams kyis sha dang nya sha dang khur ba dang 'bras chan dang zan dron la sogs pa bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du ma gnang ba ma yin te 'dul ba la sogs par dge slong rnams kyis sha dang nya sha dang khur ba dang 'bras chan dang zan dron la sogs pa bza' bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that they are not allowed in all cases, because the Vinaya and so on state that monks should eat meat, fish, pastries, rice, barley, and so on.

analyzed: de la chang ni theg pa chen po'i gsang sngags phal cher dam tshig gi rdzas su gsungs pa yin pa dang gzhung 'di pa rnams su gsal bar bkag pa ste /
translated: With regard to alcohol, most Mahayana secret mantra texts state that it is a pledge substance, but it is clearly prohibited in this treatise.

original: de yang dam tshig brjod pa'i skabs nas /
analyzed: de yang dam tshig brjod pa'i skabs nas /
translated: The Tantra Requested by Subahu states:

analyzed: nyes pa kun gyi rtsa gzhi'o //
translated: The root of all faultsüîΩis alcohol.

original: chang ni btung bar mi bya'o //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chang ni btung bar mi bya'o //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Do not drink alcohol.

original: dur khrod la sogs par gnas pa ni chags pa bskyung pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa nyid yid la bya ba'i phyir dang / dam pa'i chos la brtson 'grus bskyed pa'i phyir 'dul ba la sogs par yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag / dur khrod song la keng rus ltos //
analyzed: dur khrod la sogs par gnas pa ni chags pa bskyung pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa nyid yid la bya ba'i phyir dang / dam pa'i chos la brtson 'grus bskyed pa'i phyir 'dul ba la sogs par yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag / dur khrod song la keng rus ltos //
translated: Monks, go to the charnel ground and look at the skeleton.

original: de 'dra'i gzugs su gnas 'gyur zhing //üîΩde yi rang bzhin 'di la ni //
analyzed: de 'dra'i gzugs su gnas 'gyur zhing // de yi rang bzhin 'di la ni //
translated: Your body will come to resemble that.

original: kun nas chags par mi bya'o //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'i phyir rab tu byung ba dang gsang sngags @10a * //
analyzed: kun nas chags par mi bya'o // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir rab tu byung ba dang gsang sngags @10a * //
translated: Do not be attached to its nature.

original: 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction between renunciation and secret mantra.

original: yang 'dir rus pa'i rgyan la sogs pa yang don dam par rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i rtags dang / kun rdzob tu mi rtag pa nyid ston pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang 'dir rus pa'i rgyan la sogs pa yang don dam par rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i rtags dang / kun rdzob tu mi rtag pa nyid ston pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, here, there is no contradiction between the bone ornaments and so forth and the ultimate abandonment of conceptuality, and the conventional teaching of impermanence.

original: gcer bu yang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i rtags su bstan pa'i phyir mi 'ga' zhing bag tshab med par bya'o //
analyzed: gcer bu yang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i rtags su bstan pa'i phyir mi 'ga' zhing bag tshab med par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should be fearless and without embarrassment.

original: de la gang dag gsang sngags rnams su ni dbang gi kun du spyod pas mi 'dra ba nyid do zhes na /
analyzed: de la gang dag gsang sngags rnams su ni dbang gi kun du spyod pas mi 'dra ba nyid do zhes na /
translated: Those who say that the conduct of empowerment is different in the mantra vehicle

original: de ni mi shes pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: de ni mi shes pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
translated: are ignorant.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje thod kyi rgyud nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdo rje thod kyi rgyud nas /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said in the Vajra T√∂ng Tantra:

original: so so thar dang byang chub sems //
analyzed: so so thar dang byang chub sems //
translated: Through the vows of individual liberation, bodhicitta,

original: gsang sngags rang gi sdom pa yis //
analyzed: gsang sngags rang gi sdom pa yis //
translated: and the mantra vows themselves,

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam la brten //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam la brten //
translated: one relies on the path to liberation.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir sdom pa yin par rig par bya zhing dbang zhes bya bas rigs pa ma yin pa'i chos logs shig ston par ni mi bsam mo //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir sdom pa yin par rig par bya zhing dbang zhes bya bas rigs pa ma yin pa'i chos logs shig ston par ni mi bsam mo //
translated: Therefore, one should know that the vows are the same, and one should not think that the term ‚Äúempowerment‚Äù teaches a separate, unreasonable doctrine.

original: de la gsum ka yang dbang yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gsum ka yang dbang yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know that all three are empowerments.

original: gcig ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang / gcig ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang / gcig ni gsang sngags la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gcig ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang / gcig ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang / gcig ni gsang sngags la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang zhes bya ste /
translated: One is called empowerment because it empowers one to control the well spoken Dharma and Vinaya, one is called empowerment because it empowers one to control the bodhisattva Dharma and one is called empowerment because it empowers one to control the secret mantra.

original: dper na mi gang dag rgyal rigs su gyur kyang de'i spyod yul la dbang byar med pa las /
analyzed: dper na mi gang dag rgyal rigs su gyur kyang de'i spyod yul la dbang byar med pa las /
translated: For example, there are people who are born into the royal caste, but they do not have control over their domain.

original: stobs dang rkyen gyi dbang gis phyis bram ze la sogs pas yul 'khor thams cad kyi phyir dbang bskur ba las de nas bzung nas rgyal po'i cha byad bzung ste /
analyzed: stobs dang rkyen gyi dbang gis phyis bram ze la sogs pas yul 'khor thams cad kyi phyir dbang bskur ba las de nas bzung nas rgyal po'i cha byad bzung ste /
translated: However, due to the power of their strength and conditions, later on they are empowered by the brahmins and so forth to control the entire country. From that point on, they take on the appearance of a king.

original: spyod yul gyi grong khyer la dbang byed pa dang de las 'dod pa dang / de'i 'bras bu sna tshogs pa 'byung ba bzhin du /
